author: A Google User
comment: Remove ads, add a persistent menu instead of having to scroll back to the top menu, add view on map and stop spending money on celebrity adverts when your app is so bad. Unfortunately there are a few properties on here that aren't on domain which absolutely wipes the floor with this app. They recently contacted me to retest the app. It's slightly better but still clunky and unusable.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi there, thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day, and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Luke

author: Brittney Hayes
comment: Filtering system is terrible. If I wanted to look at houses over 400k I'd filter it so. Please fix.

author: Justin Plummer
comment: From a horrible update years ago to a stable system now. Good app guys and gals, we all make mistakes but not everyone learns. Keep it up!

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Justin, Thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with stability and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Ben

author: Mel Smith
comment: Much better and easier to use than it was when I first reviewed it 5 years ago. Pretty much does all that I'd expect.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Mel, thanks for providing your review 5 years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved(and fast with a ton of new features) app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet ? Love to hear back your thoughts on the latest app. Regards Allan

author: A Google User
comment: This app has improved alot lately. Quite impressive. Thanks Yunlong 👍

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi there, Thanks for providing your review many years ago, Just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Yunlong

author: A Google User
comment: 02 Mar 2018 Updated review. New version includes a Collection"" feature which allows us to define Collections lists and to save properties to these lists. It works really well now. I have updated my review to reflect this.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi there, Thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with saving properties and wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Kat

author: Sharon Hill
comment: Keeps auto rotating the screen even when the function is turned off on my phone. It's the only app on my phone that does this.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Sharon, Thanks for providing your review some time ago, we are aware we had some issues a little while ago. We have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Would love to know your thoughts now. Regards Luke

author: Petar Jovicic
comment: Easy to use. Well laid out. Easy to save searches.
Not that user friendly domain is much easier to use!

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi there, thanks so much for taking the time in providing feedback. Love to know why you don't feel it is as user friendly. We are always making changes and your feedback will help us improve the app for others and of course you.     Looking forward hearing from you. Regards Luke

author: Nathan Reid
comment: Great app now, through many improvements and enhancements is easy to use and search for property

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Nathan, Thanks for providing your review some time ago, we are aware we had some issues a little while ago. We have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Would love to know your thoughts now. Regards Luke

author: Nivedita Wagh
comment: Perfect one stop shop app. Quite user friendly too.

author: Đạt Lê Thành
comment: Great app

author: Harry Bennett
comment: Great App, very user friendly & a wealth of information.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Thanks Harry for your review. How can we get to 5?  Regards Luke

author: Suneeth U Rao
comment: Wonderful app..just needs map based  search

author: Juanita Davis
comment: So quick and easy when your on the go?
I personally find it great to use

author: Nate Clarke
comment: Good quality app

author: Siva Hesavan
comment: Well designed

author: Steven Cox
comment: Originally rated as a one star in 2012 as it was not comparable with new tablet. Contacted by developer in 2018 to update my rating. Happy to report that I have been using the app for some years now and they are keeping up with technology. It works as advertised and in QLD anyway is almost essential to use if looking for listed property. As an investor, it would be nice to have the ability to have a simple text list (even export it)  instead of trawling past glossy photos and adverts,  but as the agents pay for development  I suppose they need their spot in the sun and the average buyer nowadays like the glam so they can buy on emotions.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Steven, Thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues with supported devices and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and and were wondering if you'd had the chance to use it yet?  We'd love to hear your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Tim

author: Peter Sibilant
comment: App has now become useless now that you're required to create an account to save properties with the latest version. Now using Domain instead. UPDATE: Still requires an account sign in to save properties but app is most definitely faster and more responsive. Will explore features and update this review again if found to be more feature rich than other real estate apps.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Peter, thanks for providing your review 5 years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved(and fast with a ton of new features) app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet ? Love to hear back your thoughts on the latest app. Regards Allan

author: Jonathan McKay
comment: Don't waste your time - the old app was great but for some reason they have regressed to this clunky mobile website-based app with far fewer features than that which it supersedes. Iassumed this would be temporary while a new and improved full android app was developed - unfortunately not.    UPDATE - the app has been completely re-worked since this review in 2013, and is now very functional and user friendly. Would recommend!

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Jonathan, Thanks for providing your review many years ago. We agree we had many issues back in the day and we have made a concerted effort to improve it.  We were wondering if you had the chance to use the latest version?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards, Nandini

author: Saifee Akil
comment: Compared to the domain app this app is so limited. You cannot save searches. The map search feature is so limited.... Only shows properties around your current location or a selected suburb, unlike in domain where I use the map feature to browse properties across all suburbs. Also adding calendar entries via the app does not link back to the selected property to review before you are about to leave on inspection. And no notifications at all! The app can be improved greatly  Update: this app has come a long way since my initial review. Glad the developers listened and have greatly improved it's usability and features.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Saifee, Thanks for providing your review some time ago, we are aware we had some issues a little while ago. We have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Would love to know your thoughts now. Regards Luke

author: sal leonardi
comment: Today i searched for max of 250k.. first 3 results $299k, $300k and $289k. Time to go elsewhere it really is a waste of my time.. see below review from Jan 2017 nothing has changed other than my not using it anymore. Jan 2017. I get annoyed by seeing properties that are well above the limit I've set. E.g. set limit to 400k today and saw many homes between 430k and 500k. Why bother with the limit if i don't get what i want?

author: Gabriela do Canto
comment: I've used this app on a few different androids over the last 12 months and it is extremely frustrating. When ever I try to look through photos it freezes and I have to start my search again. When I click sort it crashes half the time. Domain here I come.  3 years later and I've been using this app on and off. It is definitely reliable now and no complaints.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Gabriela, thanks for providing your review 3 years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with stability and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved(and fast) app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet ? Love to hear back your thoughts on the latest app. Regards Allan

author: Kupio Kerr
comment: I used this app years ago and it was lousy. I rated it 1-star. The app developer contacted me about their improvements. They've actually fixed the map browsing issues and its now an excellent app for browsing properties. 5-stars.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Kupio, thanks for providing your review 5 years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with stability and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved(and fast with a ton of new features) app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet ? Love to hear back your thoughts on the latest app. Regards Allan

author: Conan Uren
comment: I cannot get this app to keep me signed in. Every property I want to save I have to sign in again. And again. And again. I usually love this app. Please fix asap and I will adjust feedback accordingly.  Update: All good now!!

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Conan, thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with stability, and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Luke

author: Nathan Carroll
comment: This app was great and made finding places easy but in the recent update you removed saved searches. I'm not sure what you were thinking doing this as it's a very needed feature and in my opinion has made the app frustrating.  Edit Yeah my saved searches aren't there and I'm still getting notifications for them even when I want to delete them. Why lie to me? Cheers

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Nathan, Im sorry about that. Your saved searches are on the home screen.  There is a tab/switch with a gold star. Click on that and you will see all your Saved Searches when you are signed in. Then you can click on the 3 dots and that will display a menu for you to 'unsave' or turn off notifications. Let me know how you go with it. Regards Luke

author: Chris Migliore
comment: On the website you can search an entire state...though the app you can't. Would be nice to have this option in the app also.   Would also like to be able to filter out Turnkey offers when I search.  Otherwise, love it.

author: Cameron Harwood
comment: Buyers are forced to use this app because most houses are on it. But the search function is incredibly clunky and frustrating.  I suggest following your competitors search format

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content:
Hey Cameron, 
Thanks so much for your feedback - we really appreciate it! I'd love to know a little bit more, what was the type of search you were trying to action? I can look into how we can make this run more smoothly for you. Cheers, Mark

author: BiffaPlayz
comment: The update didn't fix the land size menu bug and they haven't bought back the search by map yet. Save your phones space and just make a short cut to their website.  Edit: The app has vastly improved in the past 4 years, I used it to find my first home and currently using it to find another home.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi BiffaPlayz, Thanks for providing your review some time ago, we are aware we had some issues a little while ago. We have a much improved app now and and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Would love to know your thoughts now. Regards Luke

author: Diana Drake-Brockman
comment: I want to be able to filter house and land packages out. To many of them its vsry frustrating.

author: Vasili Syrakis
comment: Didn't even remember that I left a 1 star review in 2015! These days it's the only app I use to look for rentals. Really easy to map out and filter places.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Vasili, Thanks for providing your review some time ago, we are aware we had some issues a little while ago. We have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Would love to know your thoughts now. Regards Luke

author: Bekk Worth
comment: Looking for rentals is a nuisance and this app takes some of the annoyance away. And love looking at a wishlist of properties to buy 🤣

author: Daniel Bradshaw
comment: Great app. The negative reviews seem more to be bad experiences with realestate agents, no reflection on the app.  Weino's be weino's.

Options for searching need to be vastly improved. For example when filtering out unfer offer properties, many are still shown. You cannot exclude properties from being displayed after eliminating them.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content:
Hi there,
Thanks so much for writing to us! We really appreciate the feedback! If you filter out 'under offer' properties and they are still showing up - it means the agents haven't ticked them properly. If you could report them to us on customercare@realestate.com.au we will sort it out! Cheers, Kat

author: clif bartram
comment: It is better in 2018 but still a long shot from what it was years ago. Add more search options at the start not after and I will update my review again.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content: Hi Clif, Thanks for providing your review many years ago, we are aware we had some issues back in the day with stability and just wanted to let you know we have a much improved app now and wondering if you had the chance to use it yet?  Love to know your thoughts on the updated app. Regards Luke

author: Scrogg Dogg
comment: Can't search by suburb or postcode. EDIT- after a response from the dev I tried searching by suburb and it worked fine. Wrote the review too long ago to remember why I wrote this. Changed rating.

reply.author: realestate.com.au
reply.content:
Hi Scrogg,
Thanks so much for writing to us - i'd love tobe able to help you as you can definately search by suburb :) also when you enter a post code - a suburb will pop up. to do this you start writing the suburn in the search field and then select the correct one. Let me know if this doesn't work for you and i'll try and help. Cheers, Kat

author: Dan Dyzlexic
comment: Would be better if properties that were under application were taken down quicker. Makes searching fpr rentals a lot more difficult.

author: Ryan Fendley
comment: Price filters allow agents to under quote. Price enquiry emails to agents often come back with prices above search filters used. Annoying!

author: Alyssa Smedley
comment: Would be good if properties already viewed could be marked somehow. Tired of repeatly opening the same one week after week
